sentence.text: A physiotherapist stated , for instance : ` What we want to develop in them is the motivation to try and tackle society , take it head on so that they can actually say I want to go and do this , I want to go and do something else . ''
That was the motivation to bring home the bacon , even if it was only Spam . ''
There must also be the motivation to take advantage of these factors .

Where the boss 's response to a complaint might well be ` If you do n't like it you can always leave '' , then sticking with a job you do not like implies that you lack the motivation to go and find something more satisfactory , or that you are incapable of finding anything better .
David insisted on proceeding with his intentions despite the opposition of Joab , his commander-in-chief , who sensed the wrong motivation for the exercise .
That is one of the main motivations behind my motion .
Speculation surrounds the motivation behind the sale of an important group of seven works by Cézanne in the London 30 November Impressionist and Modern sale .
What is the motivation behind our involvement ?

Even so , the pupil 's motivation to use sight purposefully , his interest in the task in hand , the appropriateness of task lighting and position of work can sometimes enable material to be used with surprisingly little adaptation .
Penguin 's motivation is to ensure that a core stock of its titles is always available in the stores .

On the other hand , Groove Tubes ' primary motivation is serving the music community by offering a product for the artist and musician who can hear the difference between guitars , amps , pickups and tubes .

The pre-court ` tribunal '' investigation employed in Sheffield and the growing emphasis being placed on ways that schools can improve pupils ' motivation to attend through curriculum development and new approaches to teaching , serve as illustrations of the perceived inappropriateness of formal legal intervention other than in extreme cases .

Late-night scheduling has been a consistent feature of lesbian and gay programming , exploiting the gay audience 's motivation to watch these programmes while keeping them on the edges of broadcasting .

In her primping performance as Amy Johnson in They Flew Alone ( 1942 ) , Anna Neagle is allowed to express none of the deeper motivations for her character 's decision to defy convention and take up flying , and the film never tries to make anything of its contrast between Johnson 's individualism and its concluding images of girls marching , clearly anything but individuals .

The motivation for our search was to see how signs might support the spoken message in schools , how deaf children could be given the benefit of the happy accident which allowed two modalities to be used simultaneously to present two languages .

Thus the primary motivation of professionals is public service rather than personal gain : doctors are concerned primarily with the health of their patients rather than with lining their own pockets .
In the absence of modern opinion-surveys , the motivation of Nazi voters can only be inferred .

It concentrates on the relationship between altarpiece and its original physical and liturgical context , and the patrons ' motivation in such lavish spending .
